description: Build momentum through positive additions where each idea becomes a launching pad - use prompts like 'Yes and we could also...' to create energetic collaborative flow
Silent idea generation followed by building on others' written concepts - gives quieter voices equal contribution while maintaining documentation
Use random words/images as creative catalysts to force unexpected connections - breaks through mental blocks with serendipitous inspiration
Generate solutions from multiple stakeholder perspectives to build empathy - embody different roles asking what they want and how they'd approach problems
Rapid-fire idea building under time pressure creates urgency and breakthroughs - 30-second additions with quick building to maintain creative momentum
Explore radical possibilities by questioning all constraints - 'What if we had unlimited resources?' 'What if the opposite were true?' Perfect for breaking stuck thinking
Find creative solutions by drawing parallels to other domains - ask 'This is like what?' to connect to existing solutions and transfer successful patterns
Deliberately flip problems upside down to reveal hidden assumptions - ask 'What if we did the opposite?' Great when conventional approaches fail
Strip away assumptions to rebuild from fundamental truths - ask 'What do we know for certain?' Essential for breakthrough innovation
Connect unrelated concepts to spark innovative bridges - take two unrelated things and find connections to generate unexpected solutions
Explore solutions across different time periods - 'How would this work in the past?' 'What about 100 years from now?' Reveals constraints and opportunities
Use extended metaphors as thinking tools - transforms abstract challenges into tangible narratives by extending and mapping metaphor elements
Transfer solutions from completely different industries - ask how industry X would solve this to spark breakthrough innovations
Merge two or more existing concepts to create entirely new categories - goes beyond simple combination to genuine innovation
Generate problems instead of solutions - ask 'What could go wrong?' to identify hidden opportunities and reveal solution insights
Engage all five senses to discover multi-dimensional solution spaces - ask what ideas feel, smell, taste or sound like
Drill down through layers of causation to uncover root causes - ask 'Why?' repeatedly until reaching fundamental drivers. Essential for solving at source
Systematically explore all possible parameter combinations - identify key parameters, list options for each, try combinations to find patterns
Use deliberately provocative statements to extract useful ideas - ask 'What if [provocative statement]?' to catalyze breakthrough thinking
Challenge and flip core assumptions to rebuild from new foundations - ask 'What assumptions are we making?' Essential for paradigm shifts
Generate questions before seeking answers - ask only questions, no answers yet. Ensures solving the right problem by exploring problem space
Identify and visualize all constraints - categorize as technical, business, temporal, regulatory. Find pathways around or through limitations
Study successful failures to extract valuable insights - ask what went wrong, why it failed, what lessons emerged. Learns from what didn't work
Allow solutions to emerge organically without forcing linear progression - ask what patterns emerge and what wants to happen naturally
Channel pure childhood curiosity and wonder - ask what 7-year-old you would ask, use 'why why why' questioning, make it fun. Cuts through adult complications
Explore what you're actively avoiding or resisting - examine unconscious blocks by asking what scares you and mining shadows for buried wisdom
Excavate deep personal values driving decisions - dig to bedrock motivations by asking what really matters and what's non-negotiable
Seek wisdom from wiser future self - ask your 80-year-old self what they'd tell younger you for long-term perspective and temporal mentoring
Let physical sensations and gut feelings guide ideation - ask what your body says and where you feel it. Taps somatic intelligence
Grant explicit permission to think impossible thoughts - give yourself permission to explore, experiment and break free from self-imposed barriers
Systematic creativity through seven lenses: Substitute, Combine, Adapt, Modify, Put to other uses, Eliminate, Reverse. Methodical product improvement
Explore through six perspectives: White (facts), Red (emotions), Yellow (benefits), Black (risks), Green (creativity), Blue (process). Comprehensive analysis
Visually branch ideas from central concept - put main idea in center, branch concepts, identify sub-branches. Perfect for organizing complex thoughts
Generate solutions by imposing extreme limitations - 'What if you had only $1?' Forces essential priorities and creative efficiency
Map out all possible decision paths and outcomes - visualizes complex choice architectures by identifying paths and decision points
Create systematic grid of problem variables and solution approaches - identify variables, approaches, test combinations, find optimal pairings
Borrow attributes from successful solutions in unrelated domains - ask what traits make success X work and how to transfer them here
Categorize elements as Must/Should/Could/Won't - clarify priorities and manage expectations. Essential for MVP definition
Analyze Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, Threats - 360 degree strategic view for comparing approaches and making decisions
Multicriteria decision matrix with weighted criteria - define criteria, assign weights, score options objectively for traceable decisions
Anticipate failures before they happen - project into future where project failed, identify causes, define preventive mitigations
Interview past/present/future selves for temporal wisdom - playful method gaining perspective across different life stages and timeline views
Examine familiar problems through completely foreign eyes - adopt outsider's bewildered perspective to reveal hidden assumptions
Start with impossible fantasy solutions then reverse-engineer - dream impossible then work backwards to reality identifying bridging steps
Let different emotions lead separate sessions then harmonize - explore angry, joyful, fearful, hopeful perspectives then combine all voices
Explore solutions under alternative reality rules - change fundamental assumptions about physics, social norms, history to break conventional thinking
Embody different archetypes to access diverse wisdom - become the archetype and ask how persona would solve this
Deliberately break things to discover robust solutions - ask 'What if everything went wrong?' Build anti-fragility through stress-testing
Plant unexpected solutions in unlikely places - use surprise and unconventional placement for stealth innovation
Take what works from anywhere and remix without permission - encourages rule-bending rapid prototyping and maverick thinking
Design solutions for extreme survival scenarios - strips away all but essential functions to find core value in survival mode
Explain complex ideas with uninhibited simplicity - no filter, raw thoughts, simplify to absurdity. Removes overthinking barriers
Generate ways to make the problem worse - reveals hidden assumptions through destructive creativity asking how to sabotage this
Hold multiple contradictory solutions simultaneously - explore how all solutions could be true at once until observation collapses to best
Imagine solutions being sculpted by natural elements - explore how earth, fire, water, air would shape this for primal creative energy
Study how nature solves similar problems - ask how nature would solve this to access 3.8 billion years of evolutionary wisdom
Analyze problem as ecosystem - identify symbiotic relationships, natural succession, ecological principles for systems thinking
Apply evolutionary principles to improve solutions - ask what selective pressures apply and how this adapts over time
Recognize how observing solutions changes their behavior - ask how observing changes this and how to use observer effect advantageously
Explore how solution elements might be connected regardless of distance - reveals hidden relationships between distant parts
Hold multiple potential solutions until constraints force single outcome - ask what if all options were possible then what forces collapse
Draw upon traditional knowledge systems - ask how specific cultures would approach this to access overlooked problem-solving methods
Mix cultural approaches like fusion cuisine - ask what happens when mixing culture A with B for innovation through cross-pollination
Apply ritual design principles for transformative experiences - ask what ritual would transform this using anthropological insights
Use myths and archetypal stories as frameworks - ask what myth parallels this to tap into collective unconscious
